video.title: Full Stack Web App using Vue.js & Express.js: Part 6 - Search
video.description:
Welcome to part 6 of a new series where I will create a full stack web application using Vue.js and Express.js

GitHub repo: https://github.com/codyseibert/tab-tracker

Follow Cody on Twitter: https://twitter.com/CodyLSeibert

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: Дмитрий Борщевский
topLevelComment.text: Can someone please explain me how does it's search query work on 17:00? I can't understand what is going on in where statement

topLevelComment.author: Amit Ranganathan
topLevelComment.text: How would i go about deleting an actual song from the database? I tried following the same logic as deleting a bookmark, but am having problems.  Would love some help asap! :)

topLevelComment.author: Darius Goore
topLevelComment.text: for some reason, when bookmarks are saved, the UserId is saved as null.  SongId is accurate.  Anyone have a fix?

replies.author: Clirim Ajeti
replies.text:
I changed 
"const {songId, userId} = req.body; " to 
 "const songId = req.body.params.songId
 const userId = req.body.params.userId"

topLevelComment.author: Paul Borek
topLevelComment.text: At around 46:25: if bookmark is null you should reply with a 204 (no data). Not sure if it is specified what body to send in this case

topLevelComment.author: DaR
topLevelComment.text: 17:50 For sequelize 4.41.0, the $or and $like have been changed to [Op.or] and [Op.like] respectively. Add const { Op } = require('sequelize'); at your 1st line before changing them.

replies.author: Noisy Trace
replies.text: Thanks! that saved me a lot of hardship

topLevelComment.author: zuber Ab
topLevelComment.text: 26:19 <div class="red--text" v-html="error" />

topLevelComment.author: QA Hoang
topLevelComment.text: Newest version of sequelize (4.39.0) has a bug where $or operator does not work which generates an "Invalid value {title: '$like': ...} error. Reverting to version 4.8.0 like Cody's works.

replies.author: Mark Edward
replies.text: it has been too long to answer this but to fix this. You need to add const { Op } = require("sequelize"); on top of the page and change the $or and $like to [Op.or] and [Op.and]

topLevelComment.author: Alex Leibowitz
topLevelComment.text: Another option for persisted states: https://jsfiddle.net/clemarc/uecadt8m/1/

replies.author: RTW590
replies.text: Thanks for this, I might give it a shot. Do you know when in the video he does persist the state to localstorage? I have been going through the videos and I have not found it yet.

topLevelComment.author: Alex Leibowitz
topLevelComment.text: So is the bookmark relation being set as 1:1 or mahy to many?  Because the bookmark table ends up looking like a many to many association, but the methods you use to define it are for 1-1 according to the Sequelize docs...

topLevelComment.author: Alex Leibowitz
Razva Cos
topLevelComment.text: SAILS. JS + VUE. JS and jwt auth please

topLevelComment.author: george Iosifelis
topLevelComment.text: Very good tutorial, well done.   FYI, I am using vue-router 3.0.1 and at 9:55 (where you create the search query), const route={name:'songs'} does not work.  Use {path:'song'}

replies.author: Lugwes
replies.text: nice, thank you. {path:'songs'} is the correct one

replies.author: Anne Z
replies.text: You are right! Thanks for the solution!

topLevelComment.author: Harjit Singh
topLevelComment.text:
Hello Sir, Thank you for this series. I am learning an lot from this and also figuring out what else to learn more. I have found out that for showing/hiding an element v-show can also be used. Here is an example which I have used instead of v-if for bookmark buttons in SongsMetadata.vue. My understanding is that it is a matter of choice but it's good to know alternate ways as well.

                   <v-btn
                        v-show="$store.state.isUserLoggedIn"
                        dark 
                        class="cyan"  
                        @click="unbookmark">
                        Bookmark
                    </v-btn>

topLevelComment.author: Алексей Воробьёв
topLevelComment.text:
Amazing tus. 
Thank you! 

ESLINT Extension  for vscode can help with autofixing small problems like extra semicolon or whitespaces or whatever. You even can set it up to autofix on file save. 
Also why don't you use Ctrl/Cmd + P in order to search for files
Hopefully will be useful for somebody else

topLevelComment.author: Krisan Paulino
topLevelComment.text: Hey, Im not a native English speaker. I still don't get it why we have to make seeds. Pls someone explain it to me by replying to this comment.

replies.author: Juan Sm
replies.text:
Along the course he'd reset the data on the database by changing by setting "force: true" in app.js in the server.
But then he'd have to fill all the data from scratch. 
The idea is to use this seed folder to re-populate it automatically.

replies.author: Peter Ulev
replies.text: I get the same problem, this is really strange... thanks for the solution btw

replies.author: msimundz
replies.text:
for some weird reason await Promise.all in seed/index.js is not working as expected... first its trying to seed songs then create bookmarks and create users. It seems to work properly only after I introduce a hackity hack with delay  https://jsfiddle.net/tvstdewg/
Not sure why...

Thanks in advance for your answer!

topLevelComment.author: rojimark
topLevelComment.text: Hey Cody.Thanks. Quick question though. At 13:46, you were gonna say that if you change the search value to an empty string...., it would give an error? I am getting an error on empty string. I get a status code 304 Not Modified when hitting http://localhost:8081/songs. Any suggestions how to go about it?

replies.author: rojimark
replies.text: Nevermind. I got it figured out. Thanks again! :)

topLevelComment.author: MTandi
topLevelComment.text:
I've got a problem with debounce - when I try to change the route within these 700 miliseconds, I'm navigated back to the page with debounce.

Had to change following line in the debounce function:
this.$router.push(route)
to:
if (this.$route.name === 'songs') this.$router.push(route)
